transportAdvice: Komodo Island itself has no public transit; visitors typically arrive by boat from Labuan Bajo and explore the national park on foot with a ranger guide. Taxis and ojeks (motorcycle taxis) are available in Labuan Bajo, but the island and its trails are navigated entirely on foot.

weather.description: Hot and wet with frequent afternoon downpours; seas can be rough, making boat crossings less comfortable.
Continued wet season with heavy rain and high humidity; some boat tours may be limited by weather.
Rain begins to ease toward month's end but humidity remains high; landscapes are lush and green.
Transitional month with decreasing rainfall and improving sea conditions for diving and snorkeling.
Dry season begins in earnest; warm and sunny with good visibility for underwater activities.
Cooler and drier with strong southeast winds; excellent diving conditions but choppy seas possible.
Peak dry season with clear skies and low humidity; strong winds can make some crossings bumpy.
Dry and sunny with excellent visibility; one of the best months for trekking and wildlife spotting.
Winds begin to ease and conditions remain excellent for both land and water activities.
Warm and mostly dry with calmer seas; a great month to visit before the wet season returns.
Humidity rises and occasional showers return; still generally pleasant for outdoor exploration.
Wet season resumes with increasing rainfall and rough seas; boat access can be disrupted on stormy days.
